summary: An email from October 11, 2019, regarding a request from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Warden about whether the Special Housing Unit cell where Jeffrey Epstein was housed and died can be returned to normal use for inmates. The sender states they will check with the Investigative Team and respond the following week.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document references the cell in the Special Housing Unit where Jeffrey Epstein was housed and where the incident (his death) occurred.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York contacted the email sender to ask for confirmation on whether the cell where Jeffrey Epstein died could be returned to normal use for housing inmates.

events.title: Warden's Inquiry About Epstein's Cell
events.description: The Warden of MCC NY contacts the email sender to ask for confirmation on whether the Special Housing Unit cell where Jeffrey Epstein was housed and died can be reopened for normal inmate use.

keyFacts: The email is dated October 11, 2019, after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
The Warden of MCC NY sought confirmation from an investigative team before reopening the cell where Epstein died for normal inmate housing.
The cell had been secured and unoccupied since the incident (Epstein's death), indicating it was preserved as part of an investigation.
The correspondence shows ongoing administrative and investigative procedures following Epstein's death in custody.
